subject: OT: final
msgSnippet: Mike Bowler got me in the habit of using final where possible, so I asked him to read the article. Here is his response. ... J. B. Rainsberger, President,
messageBody:
Mike Bowler got me in the habit of using 'final' where possible, so I asked him to read the article. Here is his response.

>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>> This came up in the JUnit mailing list. I don't know whether you've
>> already read it. It might change your use of 'final'.
>
>I hadn't read it but it doesn't change anything for me :-)
>
>My main reason for using final is to better explain my *intent* to the
>compiler. This gives the compiler the opportunity to....
>
>1) Provide better warning messages when I make a mistake
>2) Generate faster code
>
>The first is significantly more important to me than the second. Real
>performance increases will come from changing algorithms, not inlining
>methods.
>
>Having said that, I do occasionally get hung up on performance and tune
>places that really aren't helping that much but nobody's perfect :-)
>
>--
>Mike Bowler
>Principal, Gargoyle Software Inc.
>Voice: (416) 822-0973 | Email : mbowler@...
>Fax : (416) 822-0975 | Website: http://www.GargoyleSoftware.com

J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
